gurmukhi: ju`Du krXo irs Awpis mY duhUM Ern qy nhI koaU try ]brCI gih bwn kmwn gdw As lY kir mY ieh BwNiq lry ]
transliteration: Juddh(u) Daryo Ris Aapas(i) Mai Duhoon Oran Te Nahikooo Dare|| Barchhigadh Baan Karmaan Godaa As Lai Kar(i) Mai Eh Bhaant(i) Dare||
translation: From both sides, the warriors fought bravely with great anger and none of them retraced his steps; they are fighting quite nicely with spears, bows, arrows, maces, swords etc; someone is falling down while fighting,

gurmukhi: koaU jUiJ igry koaU rIJ iBry iCq dyK fry koaU Dwie pry ]mnXO aupjI aupmw rn dIp ky aUpr Awie pqMg jry ]1066]
transliteration: Ko( i)  Joojh(i) Gire Ko( i)  Reejh Bhire Chhit Dekh Dare Ko( i)  Dhaae Dare|| Manyaoun Oupjioupmaa Ran Deep Ke Oopar Ae Patan Dare||1066||
translation: Someone is getting pleased, someone seems frightened by viewing the battlefield and someone is running; the poet says that it appears that the warriors like moths are getting burnt on the battlefield like the earthen lamp.1066.

gurmukhi: piRQmy sMig bwn kmwn iBrXo brCI br lY pun BRwq murwrI ]Pyr lrXo As lY kr mY Ds kY irp kI bhu sYn sMGwrI ]
transliteration: Prithame San(i) Baan Kamaan Bhiryo Barchhibar Lai Poun Bhraat Murdaree|| Pher Daryo As Lai Kar Mai Dhas Kai Rip Kibahu Sain Sanhdaree||
translation: Balram fought earlier with bow and arrows and then he began the fight, taking his spear in his hand; then he took the sword in his hand, killed the warriors penetrating in the army,

gurmukhi: Pyir gdw gih kY su hqy bhuro ju huqy gih pwn ktwrI ]AYNcq XO hl so dl ko ijm KYNcq duie kir JIvr jwrI ]1067]
transliteration: Pher(i) Gadaa Gadh Kai Su Hate Bahuro Ju Houte Gadh Paan Katdaree|| Ainchat Yon Hal So Dal Ko Jim Khainchat Due Kar(i) Jheevar Jdaree||1067||
translation: Then holding his dagger, he knocked down warriors with his mace; Balram is pulling the enemy’s army with his plough like the palanquin-bearer making effort to putt the water with both the hands.1067.

gurmukhi: jo Bt swmuih Awie ArXo bir kY hirjU soaU mwr igrwXo ]lwj Bry joaU jor iBry iqn qy koaU jIvq jwn n pwXo ]
transliteration: Jo Bhat Saamuh(i) Aaedaryo Bar(i) Kai Har(i)joo Sooo Maar Giraayo|| Laaj Ddare Jooo Jor Bhire Tin Te Ko( i)  Jeevat Jaan Na Paayo||
translation: Any warrior who came in front of him, Krishna knocked his down he, who getting shy of his weakness, fought with great force, he also could not survive;

gurmukhi: bYT qbY pRqnw Ar kI mD sXwm Gno pun ju`Du mcwXo ]sRI blbIr su DIr gihXo irp ko sB hI dl mwr BgwXo ]1068]
transliteration: Baith Tabai Pratnaa Ar Kieenadh Syaam Ghano Poun Juddh(u) Machadyo|| Sribalbeer Su Dheer Gadiyo Rip Ko Sabh Hidal Maar Bhagadyo||1068||
translation: Penetrating into enemy’s forces, Krishna fought a violent battle; Balram also fought with endurance and knocked down the enemy’s army.1068.

gurmukhi: BgI cmUM cqurMgnI niRpiq inhwrI nYn ]inkit ibkit Bt jo huqy iqn pRiq bolXo bYn ]1069]
transliteration: Bhagichamoond Chaturanadinripat(i) Nihaarinain|| Nikattee Bikat(i) Bhat Jo Houte Tin Prati Bolyo Bain||1069||
translation: Jarasandh himself saw his army of four divisions running away, he said to the warriors fighting near him;1069.
Speech of the king Jarasandh addressed to the army:

gurmukhi: ju`D krY Gin sXwm jhwN qumhUM dlu lY aur Er isDwro ]bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw kir lY jdubIr ko dyh pHwro ]
transliteration: Juddh Darai Ghan(i) Syaam Jahaan Toumhoon Dal(u) Lai Uh Or Siddaro|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Kar(i) Lai Jadoubeer Ko Dekh Pradaro||
translation: “The side on which Krishna is fighting, you may all go there and strike blows to him with you bows, arrows, swords and maces;

gurmukhi: jwie n jIvq jwdv ko iqn ko rn BUm mY jwie sMGwro ]Xo jb bYn khY niRpsYn clI cqurMg jhwN rn fwro ]1070]
transliteration: Jaae Na Jeevat Jaadav Ko Tin Ko Ran Bhoom Mai Jaae Sandaro|| Yo Jab Bain Kahai Nripsain Chalichaturan Jahaan Ran Daro||1070||
translation: “No Yadava be allowed to escape from the battlefield; kill all of them;” when Jarasandh said these words, then the army set itself in ranks and marched forward towards that side.1070.
